info.title: BrandControl API - V1
info.description:
RESTful API's for Creating BrandControl Application.

Structure
Our API uses resource-oriented URL's that leverage built in features of HTTP, like authentication, verbs and response codes. All request and response bodies are JSON encoded, including error responses. Any off-the-shelf HTTP client can be used to communicate with the API. To help expedite your development we have also included this Swagger UI page. It can be used to call any of the API operations and it will clearly document the request and response for that operation. If you are using Swagger Codegen, then the link to the Swagger JSON document can be found at the top of this page.

Authentication
This API is authenticated using Access Tokens over HTTPS. Any requests over plain HTTP will fail with a 403 (Forbidden) response status code. To authenticate you must first call the authorize/verifyPassword operation. All subsequent requests are associated with a specific user and client with permissions limited to the user's capabilities.

Versioning
We use versioning for all API operations and multiple versions may be in use at the same time. It is recommended you develop against the latest version of an operation as obsolete operations will be eventually removed given advanced notice. We may also add additional tags to the JSON response or reorder JSON tags in the response for the same version of an operation. Therefore, it is strongly recommended you use a JSON parser that will not be negatively impacted if additional data is added to the response. We will never remove or change a name of an existing JSON tag in the same version. A new version of the operation will be introduced if breaking changes are required.

Rate Limiting
This API is rate limited to 100 requests per minute across all operations. All responses will include the requests-remaining header showing the remaining available requests for this 60 second block. If the request limit is reached, the API will return a 429 (Too Many Requests) response status code.

Localization
Currently our API returns date and time set in the Eastern Time Zone with Daylight Saving observed. All date/time values will also include an UTC offset. you can use this offset to localize the data and time to your desired time zone.

Testing
You will be given a username and password to start your development and testing . Initially this username will be tied to a test client only. Once you are ready to move over to production, your live client account or accounts will be added to your username. The test client will still be available if you need to do further development in the future. Your username will also grant you access to the Toll-Free portal. You can use the Portal to view activates and change your password if needed.

Support
It is recommended you reference this page often during your development as new updates to the API will be posted here. This includes new operations and new version of operations. if you require additional support please contact us at BCIDsupport@numhub.com or by phone at 844-468-6482.

rel. 231011

API Input Parameters Description for Client Use Client-ID: The Client-ID can be obtained by making a POST request to the /api/v1/authorize/token endpoint. This endpoint is used to authorize and retrieve the `Client-ID` required for further API interactions. X-Auth-Scheme: For authentication purposes, the X-Auth-Scheme parameter should be set to ATLAASROPG. This ensures that the correct authentication scheme is used when making API requests. Entity-ID: The Entity-ID can be retrieved via a GET request to the /api/v1/application endpoint. This endpoint will provide the Entity-ID associated with the application, which is necessary for identifying the entity when making API calls. Enterprise List: OSP users can obtain the list of enterprises under their account by making a GET request to the /api/v1/confirmationReports/getchildclientidandname endpoint. This will return a list of enterprises, including their Client IDs and associated names, allowing the OSP to select and interact with the correct enterprise. EID List: OSP users can retrieve the list of EIDs (Enterprise IDs) for a specific enterprise by making a GET request to the /api/v1/application/{ospId}/eids endpoint. The response will provide a list of EIDs associated with the selected enterprise, enabling OSPs to perform actions specific to those EIDs.

post.summary: Verify Password and Generate an Access Token
post.description: This operation is used to generate an Access Token given a Useremail and Password. Microsoft's office password will not work here, please reach out to our customer support team to enable password authentication for your account. The Access Token is passed in the Authorization request header for all subsequent requests using the format "Bearer {accessToken}". Access Tokens are good for 24 hours. Uses this operation to generate a new Access Token if the current Access Token has expired. A 401 (Unauthorized) response code is returned if Access Token is missing, invalid or expired.

text/plain.example:
{
  "accessToken": "token",
  "tokenType": "Bearer",
  "expiresIn": 86400,
  "user": {
    "userId": 2324,
    "userName": "msmith",
    "firstName": "Mark",
    "lastName": "Smith",
    "email": "mark.smith@email.com",
    "phoneNumber": "818-444-5555",
    "sendTextMessage": false,
    "requireMultiFactorAuth": false,
    "enabled": true,
    "lastLoginDate": "2026-02-05T17:12:07.0163412+00:00",
    "insertDate": "2026-02-05T17:12:07.0163449+00:00",
    "insertName": "User Name",
    "modifiedDate": "2026-02-05T17:12:07.0163457+00:00",
    "modifiedName": "User Name",
    "isPasswordGenerated": false
  },
  "userRoles": [
    {
      "userId": 2324,
      "roleType": "OSPAdmin",
      "description": "BrandControl: OSP Admin",
      "assigned": true
    }
  ],
  "userClients": [
    {
      "userId": 2324,
      "clientId": 123,
      "clientName": "Company A",
      "respOrgId": "XYZ12",
      "assigned": true,
      "hasBcid": null,
      "isOsp": null,
      "ospId": null
    }
  ]
}

get.description: This API is used to fetch the entire User Information including Clients and Roles.

parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

get.summary: Retrieves BCID Settlement Report
get.description:
This endpoint allows OSP or Enterprise users to retrieve the BCID Settlement Report. 

To retrieve settlement reports for all enterprises under the OSP, the Enterprise Client IDs must be provided, separated by commas. 

Example: If an OSP wants to get settlement reports for multiple enterprises, they would pass the Enterprise Client IDs as a comma-separated list, like this: clientId1, clientId2, clientId3.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:

- **CustomerEmailAddress**: Email that provided for Customer Email Address
- **Enabled**: Provides information if the client is enabled
- **ModifiedDate**: Modified Date Format: YYYY-MM-DD
- **ModifiedBy**: Provides the name of modified person

post.summary: Uploads a document and associates it with the specified application.
post.description:
This API endpoint enables an enterprise to upload a document as part of the Branded Calling onboarding application process. 

Use list all API  `/api/v1/application` to retrieve`NumhubEntityId`.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the entity to which the document is being uploaded.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

DocumentType.description:
- **LOA**: Accepted format: PDF (e.g., example.pdf)
- **LOGO**: Accepted format: BMP (e.g., example.bmp)
- **DOCUMENTS**: Accepted formats: PDF (e.g., example.pdf), Excel (e.g., example.xlsx, example.csv)

delete.summary: Deletes an uploaded document identified by its documentId and type.
delete.description:
Removes the document specified by its documentId from storage and disassociates it from any related records.

Use list all API  `/api/v1/application` to retrieve`NumhubEntityId`.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the entity

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the document to be deleted.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

200.description: Returns the response model upon successful deletion.

400.description: If the document type is invalid.

post.summary: This endpoint approves or rejects an application based on the provided status, available only to users with global admin privileges.
post.description: Allows an administrator to approve or reject an application based on its current status. - Access: Global Admin only.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the entity to authorize.

parameters.name: client-id

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

requestBody.description: The request body contains the status ("Approved" or "Rejected") and comments explaining the action.

get.summary: Get single note (provides status with available comments)
get.description:
A note represents a context with brief explanation or remark (e.g., internal rejection reason or comment).
Retrieves notes and comments (if available) associated with an application.

Required Parameters:

- `NumhubEntityId`: The Unique ID of the entity (application) to which the comments are attached.

- `noteId`: The unique ID of the note to be retrieved.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the entity to which noteId is attached

parameters.name: noteId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the note to be retrieved.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

get.summary: Downloads the  LOA (Letter of Authorization)
get.description:
BCID Appendix A - TN Authorization template, this is required for an enterprise to get onboarded 

Downloads a document from the system, to be signed by an entreprise, based on its unique identifier.

- `NumhubEntityId`: The unique ID of the application to which document is attached to be downloaded.

- Access will be restricted based on user roles or document ownership.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the entity whose document to be downloaded.

parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

post.summary: Generates and sends a one-time password (OTP) to the applicant for identity verification during the BCID application process for Step-1.
post.description: Initiates the OTP generation process for the specified application. The OTP is valid for 24 hours and is sent to the applicant's email address for verification purposes.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the application entity for which the OTP is to be generated.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

post.summary: Verifies a one-time password (OTP) entered by the applicant during the BCID application process (Step-1) for identity verification.
post.description:
Validates the OTP submitted for the specified application entity. The OTP must have been previously generated and is valid for 24 hours.
This endpoint checks whether the provided OTP matches the expected value and updates the verification status accordingly.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the application entity associated with the OTP.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: The one-time password provided by the applicant for verification.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

put.summary: Updates the display data for a specific display identity and an entity, allowing the addition or removal of associated phone numbers.
put.description:
This API modifies display identity related information tied to the provided `ChangeRequestId`.

- `changeRequestId` is used to track further changes or updates to the display identity information. 
 
- It supports both adding new numbers and removing existing ones from the record. 

- Ensure the request payload includes only the necessary changes to avoid overwriting unintended data.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

requestBody.description: The JSON payload representing the updated request data.

get.summary: Downloads display identity record information with all the collective phone numbers in XLSX (Excel) format.
get.description:
This API exports identity-related records as an Excel file, 

including the specified parameters (`NumhubEntityId`, `NumhubIdentityID `, `DirId`, `CallerName`, `CallReason`, `PhoneNumber`) within the generated spreadsheet.

The resulting file contains structured data for reporting or analysis purposes.
Ensure that all required parameters are provided.

parameters.name: NumhubIdentityId
parameters.description: Uniqued identifier used to identity display identity record to be downloaded

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: A unique identitfied used to trace the display identity that is associated with a registered entity

parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

get.summary: Retrieves In-Portal Alerts for Flagged Applications
get.description: Access: UI user This endpoint retrieves flagged application alerts for users based on their role: - Admin: Accesses all flagged reviews across all clients. - Original Service Provider: Accesses flagged reviews for itself(when acting as an enterprise) and its child enterprises. - Enterprise: Accesses only its own flagged reviews. Each enterprise can have multiple applications, and alerts are generated for reviews with 'flag' status.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth

200.description: Returns the list of alert responses.

get.summary: Gets all deals based on selected period

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
- **Daily**: Daily
- **Weekly**: Weekly
- **Monthly**: Monthly
- **Quarterly**: Quarterly
- **Yearly**: Yearly

post.summary: This API creates the application reference based on email and entityId
post.description:
This endpoint generates verification tokens(links) for the specified NumHub entity.
 
 The request body must include reference email IDs in an array format:
 
 - For a single reference email:
   "emails": ["email1"]
 
 - For two reference emails:
   "emails": ["email1", "email2"]

get.summary: Retrieves attestation entities for a specified client.
get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of attestation entities associated with the given client ID.

put.summary: Submits attestation details for a branded calling application.
put.description:
The operation performed depends on the `changesRequired` flag provided in the model
The status of the application should be set to either:
- 1: Saved - To Save the Application.
- 2: Submit - To submit the application for processing.

parameters.name: NumhubEntityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the entity registered with branded calling portal.

parameters.name: changesRequired
parameters.description: Flag indicating if the changes to the application data require validation and update.

parameters.description: Client Id the user will be operating under

parameters.name: X-Auth-Scheme
parameters.description: Select authentication scheme (e.g., 'ATLAASROPG' or 'ATLAASAACG'), Don't send any if not Azure auth
